propertyChanges.newValue: The current Claude Hooks implementation is broken. Refer to the current .claude/settings.json file and just use that, which has been confirmed to work.
Remove update dates and modified by dates from --json output unless specifically requested with a --json-verbose argument
Add the same hash from issues_{hash}.jsonl to changes.jsonl as it currently doesn't automatically merge in. Use the same hash (from the issues) so issues and changes are linked.

When  leece create is run with no arguments, it should create a new temporary text file in ~/.fleece/create/{random_hash}.txt and open a new text editor at that location with an empty YAML template containing the various issue items. It should then watch for when this text editor is closed, read the YAML and if valid create a new issue with those properties.
When an issue is complete, it should not be shown in the  leece list command unless an --all flag is passed in.

Each issue should be able to be tagged with an arbitrary number of string tags. Please add this property to issues. Tags should not contain whitespace and should be entered with comma separation in the CLI.
This is a test issue to test the dynamic issue creation feature.
The version string is currently just shown as 1.0.0. This should be updated to be based on the version number of the package release. Do this by updating the GitHub actions.
Add editor mode documentation to 'fleece create -h'

The 'fleece create -h' command currently doesn't show any information on what happens if it is run without any options. It should provide a brief description of the text editor mode in the description of the command.

The editor mode that opens when 'fleece create' is run should also open when 'fleece edit <id>' is run. Update the edit command to include this behaviour and update the documentation (both in the CLI and the docs/ folder) to suit.
Add tree view as 'fleece tree' command

The 'fleece tree' command should be added, showing the list of issues (using the same filtering behaviour as 'fleece list') in the CLI based on the parent-issues property. Just show it as a normal tree using a depth first search. If an issue is referenced by two children, only show it when it is reached in the first depth first search run, but add a small 'virtual' parent indicator above the second child issue to show the connection. Update the documentation to suit.

The 'fleece diff' and 'fleece history' commands contain similar behaviour. Just combine them into a single 'fleece diff' command which shows the current history if no arguments are provided but can do a diff if there are file names passed in

When a --dry-run flag is added to a merge command, it should just show the operations that it will perform and not actually perform the merge. This is for LLMs to be able to make decisions on merging issues without actually running the merge.
Update API to include tags, groups and linked PRs

The current Fleece.Core API apparently doesn't contain information on tags, groups  and linked PRs, which caused some issues on migration into Homespun. Check this out, it may have just been a version control issue. Otherwise, add this information to the API such that it is available to Homespun, and update the CLAUDE.md to ensure that any functionality implemented in the Cli is always just a wrapper around methods in the Core API.
Add instructions for updating issue status to the `fleece prime` command relating to PRs

When the `fleece prime` command is run, additional instructions should be provided to the LLM to change the status of related issues. Note that the available statuses will change shortly in another fleece issue to be added.

The status options should change from those mirroring the statuses commonly used for PRs to a new set of status relating to how tasks are executed. The new list should be `idea` -> `spec` -> `next` -> `progress` -> `review` -> `complete` -> `archived`. `closed` should also be available for issues that have been abandoned. Please remove `idea` from the types, as this is now a status.
PreviousIssues to be added as issue property as well as ParentIssues

Currently just ParentIssues is provided in the issue schema to describe a tree structure of issues. This should just be used to describe subtasks of tasks. As well as this, PreviousIssues should be added to allow for issues to be ordered in sequence. Add this to the issues schema and update the API, CLI and documentation to suit. The CLI will also need a `validate` command that ensures that there are no cyclic dependencies. A ParentIssue implies that a ParentIssue is dependent on the children being completed. This may be tricky to reason about, so think about any implications of this and ask questions before proceeding.

An issue should be able to have a series of questions and answers added to it, to signal that there are outstanding questions that stand in the way of completing the issue. Create a schema for questions and add this to the issue schema. Then update the API, CLI and documentation.
Add validate command for cyclic dependency detection

Add a 'fleece validate' command that checks for cyclic dependencies in PreviousIssues relationships. The command should:

1. Load all issues and build a dependency graph from PreviousIssues
2. Use depth-first search to detect cycles
3. Report any cycles found with the issue IDs involved
4. Return exit code 0 if no cycles, non-zero if cycles detected

This enables CI integration to prevent invalid dependency chains from being committed.

Follow-up from issue bUkaYe.
List now shows all issues, regardless of whether the --all flag is provided or not. The "complete", "archived", "closed" and "deleted" issues should be removed.
Add error messaging for unknown schemas

When I run  leece list --all in a project that has an unknown schema in the .fleece/issues_{hash}.jsonl file, it just says that there are no issues. Add more detailed and specific error reporting when a file is detected but the information in the file cannot be read. List the number of rows (i.e. the number of issues) and list which properties are known and which are unknown. This may require some manual parsing of the JSONL.
Create a new  leece show <ID> command that shows all of the details related to an issue.
Object reference issue when editing status
When running a command like  leece edit gsVYAO --status complete the issue is updated but an 'Error: Object reference not set to an instance of an object' is also returned
The  leece search tool no longer works, stating Error: Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'source').

It should be possible to add --commit and --push flags to the  leece create command to commit and push changes to the issues in the current branch. A  leece commit --push command should also be available to do the same thing.
Add issues update instructions to  leece prime command
When  leece prime is run, it should include instructions to always commit changes to the files in the /.fleece folder so the issues are always kept up to date.

The prime command currently returns a very long response. It should instead return a short response with basic instructions, and delegate to  leece prime {feature} subcommands for more detailed instructions as required for specific workflows.
When the  leece merge command is run with the --dry-run flag, it merges the files anyway.

In one instance merging issues didn't merge the changes file as well. See the .tmp/folder for the files that caused this issue. At the very least an error should be output and no files should be changed.
The issue and change JSONL files should have well-defined schemas now that the design has settled to prevent future regressions.

When ID is used in certain commands (such as dit), three or more characters should be sufficient to identify an issue. If three or more characters are entered, use these to find the matching issue to edit. If there is more than one issue matching this pattern, show these in a table similar to the one for the list command, with a message that there are multiple matching issues.

The backtick character  doesn't render properly in the CLI. Either fix this rendering issue by replacing with a single quote ' when rendering (don't change the issue text itself) or work out how to render it properly.
Create a TUI for fleece that runs when just  leece is run. Use Terminal.Gui v2.
No output for 'fleece prime' without '.fleece' folder
When the 'fleece prime' command is run, it should not provide any output (i.e. no prompt priming) if there is no '.fleece' folder in the repository.
If there is an existing worktree when starting an agent, just use that worktree
This currently returns the following error when starting an agent on an existing worktree.

When a new agent is started on an issue that has an existing worktree, due to not being able to create the new worktree in the folder the command fails and the agent doesn't start. If the worktree and folder already exist, the agent should instead just use start in that folder.

See logs below:

Delete unknown properties when migrate is run
When fleece migrate is run, if there are any unknown properties found these should be deleted. This can be performed by deserializing and serializing the .jsonl file when the migrate process.
Instead of having to use --type, add -y as an optional short-form switch for type.
